text: Obviously, this is kind of ugly.
You can also use one of the "iterator" approaches listed above, but, again, that may not be ideal.
Finally, you can use the "pita pocket" approach that I actually just found while googling:

code:
class Pita( object ):
    __slots__ = ('pocket',)
    marker = object()
    def __init__(self, v=marker):
        if v is not self.marker:
            self.pocket = v
    def __call__(self, v=marker):
        if v is not self.marker:
            self.pocket = v
        return self.pocket

text: Now you can do:

code:
p = Pita()
while p( next() ) != END:
    // do stuff with p.pocket!

If you're iterating over a list, you can use for e in L where e is the element and L is the list.
If you're filtering a list, you can use list comprehensions (i.e.
[ e for e in L if e % 2 == 0 ] to get all the even numbers in a list).
